reviewText: It's a fun little game that is reasonably priced.  The graphics made me think of the old arcade game Tapper" and the gameplay is satisfying for what it is.  It's ridiculous
voteText: but all in the best way possible.  Essentially your battery power is draining
helpfulPercent: and to keep yourself alive you need to lure people using certain items that appeal to them
votesHelpful: and while they are distracted you rip their hearts out and replace your battery with their heart to keep on going
votesTotal: and repeat this to get a high enough score to advance to the next level.  The catch being however that different types of characters have better hearts than others
votesFunny: so a wealthy businessman might give you 30 seconds of life to work with to find a new heart
commentsCount: while some fat slob might only give you 10 seconds.  There's also hazards and the likes to try and avoid that will shave off valuable time on your battery/heart.  The plus side is your battery can be picked back up again at any time to replace a heart
column16: and it keeps its energy with it so there is a bit of strategy involved for when to use your battery and when to use a heart.  The gameplay is very reminiscent of oldschool arcades where the focus was a high score."

reviewText:
2/10

HassleHeart is an arcade game where you utilize ?" boxes in order to gain items to trap unsuspecting people.
After you trap them in there personal indulgence you proceed to murder them and rip out their heart.
Each heart grants you a fixated amount of time to trap your next victum and awards you points.
Once you have enough points you gain the next level.

The idea isn't horrible but the repetitive execution of it is.
There is something to be said for the idea of using peoples weaknesses against them for traps but overall the gameplay is far
date: far to shallow for my personal tastes. Altho
recommended: I do enjoy the subtle psychological point that is either intentionally or not
hoursPlayed:
protrayed in this game it's not really fun. Which is kind of the point of a game. (Gasp)

Sound and video isn't horrible except for maybe the shriek as you kill people.

I would say avoid this game and spend your money elsewhere.
With the amount of cheap decent games available on steam this one simply isn't worth the time put into it.

For the record I did put a total of about 3-4 hours into it half of which was offline / not reflected in the time played.
So I did give it a fair chance and played through what it had to offer.

Make up your own mind about it
voteText: for my money however it simply wasn't worth it."

reviewText:
There isn't much content to be found here, but the content present is decent. Keep in mind that this game is only $3 and you should be pretty satisfied.

Pros:  Fun sprite graphics, unique concept, plenty of levels.
Cons:  It gets repetitive pretty quickly, the plot is pretty minimal, it takes a few minutes to figure out exactly what's going on (this isn't a huge deal, but a quick tutorial screen might have been nice for the unitiated).

The difficulty curve is pretty fair, and as the variety of targets increases and the environmental hazards show up, things get a lot more interesting. All in all, though, the gameplay is pretty straightforward, and it does eventually get stale.

All in all, this isn't a game you'll sit down with and play for hours on end. This is a nice little time waster. I might even go so far as to call it charming.

You'll spend a half-hour stealing hearts here, a half-hour stealing them there, and you'll probably finish it in a day or two. For $3 this is a worthwhile buy.
voteText: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I have closely followed the development of this game, I've played all the pre-release versions of it and I must admit that the evolution has been astonishing. It is a very simple game, with nice pixel-art (play it fullscreen to understand what I mean!) and easy gameplay. It gets more and more challenging the more you play, and this gives the game an arcade feeling that very few games have been able to emulate. All in all, HassleHeart is well worth the little money it costs.

reviewText:
Cheap, silly, and unabashedly pixel-violent. It's a great little time-waster if you don't mind being the littlest robot who needs hearts to live. And we don't mean love, we mean tearing beating organs from people's chests.

Probably my only issue having played it some, is that I've seen the game stop spawning people and thus I've run out of power because no one else comes onto the map.

Still enjoying it, though! Delicious hearts.

reviewText:
Not-Kid-Friendly:The whole premise of the game is to trap and kill people to keep yourself alive. Definitely not recommendable to kids.

Dear Brother:I gave this game a few moments of my time but I really didn’t enjoy it. I am sure that we could find better games that we can sink our time into.

Dear Wife:I doubt you would enjoy it. It isn’t worth mentioning to you at all.

Kept/REMOVED:I gave it some attention but I still couldn’t enjoy it as much as others did.

My Last Thoughts: Simply put, it’s not you, it’s me. It’s just not my type.

reviewText: This game makes me laugh! A robot that tears hearts out of people and uses it for his own? Brilliant! It's easy to pick up and tons of fun to play. It's definitely a good quickie game when you're looking for something to play but don't want to invest too much time.\n\nBonus points to the music and the references to the stereotypes. I would definitely be the white girl eating up the sushi. :P
